title.narrative: Providing Emergency assistance to IDPs and host communities in Western Equatorial State, South Sudan

description.narrative: This project targets the recently Internal Displaced persons(IDPs) and the Host Community(HC) in the Catholic Diocese of Tombura –Yambio,displaced on 18th /06 /2021 on Friday,. The conflict started in the out skirt of Tombura, and the course of the conflict is still been followed up by the security agencies on ground,but according to unverified source from the communites living there, some armed men came from Namutina and attacked some of payams such as Agiara, Kpatanataru, and Dingimo, so the conflict was between two unknown armed group who fought among themselves after less than half an hour of confrontations, the attackers withdrew and started moving from home to home, shooting randomly and burn civilians houses. If they do not come across anybody, they could only make sure that all the Tukuls are set ablaze, this escalated terra among the civilians who escaped their homes without picking anything, only to rescue themselves and their children, according to the information gathered on ground, same armed group went to South Yubu and caused the same atrocity, shooting at everybody they could come across and burning of houses with all the properties inside them,. Therefore, the estimated population of displaced people in Tombura and South Yubu is 2,540 households,according to parish priests reports, on the families seeking refuge in the churches. To make it worse there are no Nongovernmental organisations on ground to respond and recure this situation by providing humanitarian asistance but some of the organizations are planing to go to assess the damages and witness what has happened to the communities, for example, UNMISS went for assessment, but result is not yet out, therefore, these vulnerable civilian needs immediate support in terms of food ration, Non- food items and small garden tools and seeds to enable them recover from the crisses.
